DPRD DKI Setuju Anggaran Rehab Rumah Dinas Gubernur Rp 2,4 Miliar
06 Nov 2019, 04:47 by Taufiq Siddiq, Ninis Chairunnisa
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komisi D DPRD serta Dinas Cipta Karya dan Pertanahan DKI Jakarta menyepakati anggaran untuk rehab rumah dinas gubernur senilai Rp 2,4 miliar dalam Kebijakan Umum Anggaran - Prioritas Plafon Anggaran Sementara atau KUA PPAS 2020. Persetujuan itu diambil tanpa ada perdebatan dari anggota DPRD.
"Jadi anggaran Rp 2,4 miliar ini setuju," kata Ketua Komisi B Ida Mahmudah dalam rapat pembahasan KUA PPAS, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Anggota Komisi B kemudian sepakat dengan anggaran Rp 2,4 miliar tersebut. Ida sebagai pemimpin rapat mengesahkannya dengan mengetok palu.
Sebelum disepakati, Ida sempat bertanya soal anggaran tersebut. "Ini kemarin ramai nih," ujarnya.
Menanggapi hal tersebut,Kepala Dinas Cipta Tata Ruang dan Pertanahan Heru Hermawanto mengatakan rencana rehab rumah dinas gubernur DKI tersebut sudah direncanakan dari dulu.
Menurut Heru, rehab rumah dinas gubernur yang berada di Jalan Taman Suropati tersebut sudah ditunda tiga kali dari perencanaan DKI. "Ini sudah tiga kali penundaan, perencanaan sudah jauh jauh hari," ujarnya.
Dinas Citata merencakan anggaran Rp 2,4 miliar itu untuk memperbaiki atap, langit-langit dan interior. "Kalau dicek keadaannya memang sudah keropos," kata Heru saat dihubungi, Jumat, 4 Oktober 2019.
Menurut Heru, sebagian bangunan itu sudah lapuk sehingga harus diperbaiki. Apalagi rumah dinas itu telah ditetapkan sebagai cagar budaya. Rencananya, kata dia, pemerintah bakal mengganti rangka kayu atap bangunan dengan material yang lebih kuat seperti baja ringan.

DKI DPRD Agrees to Rehabilitate the House of Governor's House Budget Rp 2.4 Billion
Nov 6 2019, 04:47 by Taufiq Siddiq, Ninis Chairunnisa
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Commission D of the Regional House of Representatives and the Jakarta Office of Cipta Karya and Land agreed on a budget for the rehabilitation of official homes for the governor of Rp 2.4 billion in the General Policy Budget - Priority Ceiling Provisional Budget or KUA PPAS 2020. The agreement was taken without any debate from DPRD members.
"So the Rp 2.4 billion budget agrees," said Commission B Chairman Ida Mahmudah in the KUA PPAS discussion meeting, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Commission B members then agreed with the Rp 2.4 billion budget. Ida as the meeting leader endorsed it by knocking a hammer.
Before it was agreed, Ida had time to ask about the budget. "It was busy yesterday," he said.
Responding to this, the Head of the Spatial Planning and Land Agency, Heru Hermawanto, said that the rehabilitation plan for the Jakarta governor's official residence had been planned long ago.
According to Heru, the rehabilitation of the governor's official residence at Jalan Taman Suropati had been postponed three times from DKI's planning. "This has already been three times postponed, planning has come a long way," he said.
The Citata Office is planning a budget of Rp 2.4 billion to repair the roof, ceiling and interior. "If you check the situation it is already porous," said Heru when contacted, Friday, October 4, 2019.
According to Heru, some of the buildings were already weathered so they had to be repaired. Moreover, the official residence has been designated as a cultural preservation. The plan, he said, is that the government will replace the building's wooden truss with stronger materials such as mild steel.
